result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J. Howen

records.addlTxt: Judicial Pretrial - in court on December 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

At the request of Attorney Michel and no objection from ADA Tombasco; Victim rights compliance; JPTC on 10/20/22 is rescheduled to 12/14/22 at 10:30 am. Parties notified by email and new notice sent to DE.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan J. Howen appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Case heard with 22CF900 today.   DE requests substitution of Br 1; Br 6 assigned.  Not guilty plea entered. Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
DE requests substitution of Br 1; Br 6 assigned.

11:26 AM   State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Defendant, Ryan J. Howen, appeared in custody with Attorney William Paul Michel.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF900/22CM913. Attorney Michel advises the Court that he has previously represented the DE and the DE is requesting SPD appoint different counsel. Parties stipulate to the doctors report. Court finds defendant is competent to proceed. This matter is referred back to intake for preliminary hearing. The Court denies the DE's request to have Attorney Michel withdraw for reasons set forth on the record. Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am at Intake. Further proceedings scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:320 am at Intake.
and Cover Sheet for Confidential Records.

101PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Competency hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am. - Br. 1.
